title: Don't make your assets too bright.
text: Textures look very bright and saturated ingame. You can use reference color & material chart props, testing LUTs, and the context of other well-known assets ingame. In general, white should be below 140 RGB and black above 10 RGB. You can use a mod to replace textures ingame for testing adjustments quickly.

title: Prop Special Places for Sitting
text: It's possible to add sitting spots to props, and citizens will sit on them when those props are part of a building.

title: Correct Normal Maps
text: Some normal map generators invert normal map channels by default. The game has specific requirements for normal maps in different uses. The asset editor mesh importer can break the mesh and cause incorrectly displayed normal maps.

title: Replace Textures Ingame
text: You can use the Realtime mod to replace textures and even meshes ingame for testing purposes. This helps to quickly test color adjustments in context with other assets.

title: Animated Building Shaders
text: Some building shaders allow for simple animations, such as rotating wind turbines and multi-frame animation or scrolling textures.

title: Building Placement Mode
text: The placement mode of a building determines how the user plops the building - on the side of a road or shore, on water or anywhere on the terrain. It can also affect if your building blocks water.

title: Prop Variations
text: It's possible to add multiple props to the same prop and set probabilities, so a different prop gets plopped every time.

title: Rotors Shader for Props, Buildings, and Sub-meshes
text: This shader supports semi-transparency, so it can be used to create glass or fake water.

title: Rotors Shader for Vehicles
text: It's possible to use the rotors shader to create semi-transparent glass parts for vehicles.

title: Additive Shader
text: Create RGB illumination using additive shader props and control the time of day when they turn on.

title: Flag Params
text: The flag shader can be used to create props which contain something moving in the wind, such as flags or some kind of cloth.

title: Custom Animation Loader
text: The Custom Animation Loader mod by boformer can be used to import custom animations for buildings.

title: Detail
text: The Detail mod can be used to create props with color variations chosen by the player using sliders, intended for color matching vegetation props and trees to the map theme grass color.

title: ModTools
text: Using ModTools scene explorer and running scripts in the console is a big part of advanced asset creation.

title: Custom Vehicle Wheels
text: It's possible to avoid the automatic wheel detection by the game, and use vertex paint and tire parameters to create custom wheels manually.

title: Decals
text: Decals project textures onto the ground, they are the easiest type of asset to create, you don't need to worry about meshes or LODs. Just a diffuse and an alpha texture should be enough for most decal ideas, a script will do the rest automatically.
